node.title: 'Always the first to jump up': Penguin-protecting maremma made famous in movie Oddball dies at 13
node.alt: A close-up photo of a dog
node.description: A public memorial will be held at Warrnambool's Middle Island to honour a maremma that spent eight seasons guarding a penguin colony.
node.content:
["A penguin-protecting pooch that served eight seasons at Warrnambool's Middle Island in south-west Victoria has died aged 13.\u00a0", "Tula and her sister Eudy were the first dogs specifically trained to protect the penguin colony\u00a0after fox attacks and trampling almost wiped out the entire\u00a0colony.\u00a0", "Maremmas have guarded the island's penguins since 2006, when the population dwindled to fewer than 10.\u00a0", "The decision to introduce the Italian sheepdogs to the island was immortalised on the silver screen in 2015, turning the colony's first protector, Oddball, into a household name.\u00a0", "Tula died of old age, and is being\u00a0remembered as the \"matriarch\" of the canine pack who loved her work.\u00a0", "\"Tula was the lead guardian \u2014 she was always the first to jump up and bark if there was a threat,\u201d said Middle Island dog handler, Dr Trish Corbett.\u00a0", "\"She had such a strong instinct and loved protecting her island.\"", "", "
Tula spent eight seasons on Middle Island, doing the job made famous in the movie Oddball(Supplied: Warrnambool City Council)
", "Tula's death comes five months after sister Eudy died from bone cancer.\u00a0", "Her ashes will be scattered at Middle Island during a public memorial.\u00a0", "Dr Corbett said\u00a0Tula had endured two cruciate ligament surgeries and arthritis.", "\u201cShe was old and it was her time,\u201d she said.", "Warrnambool Mayor\u00a0Richard Ziegeler\u00a0thanked Tula for her years of service.\u00a0", "\u201cIt\u2019s the end of an era for one of the world\u2019s most innovative conservation projects,\u201d he said.", "\u201cThe legacy that Tula and her sister Eudy have created will live on in the work undertaken by the next generation of maremma guardian dogs and the dedicated people who make the project possible.\""]
